@joelight I don't think I got a confirmation reply, so someone else could have done it easily, only record would be letter at election board
@joelight Possibly. I called the election board, they told me what info was needed: full name, DOB, and address I was registered at 1/2
@joelight Me too. Until my mom called. "Got your absentee ballot. Should I send it to you or just fill it out?"
@joelight Anybody could have filled it out and submitted and I'd have been on record voting in two different states.
@joelight I did exactly that a few years ago when I was registered in AZ and MA because AZ was still sending an absentee ballot to old addr.
